intro: Orthocarpus chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
